intro: Trisetopsis galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's trisetopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
